tr.td: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

value.displayName: CONCUSSION WITH BRIEF LOSS OF CONSCIOUSNESS

translation.displayName: Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less)

code.displayName: Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

observation.value: (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB

td.content: s:m columnist aged 48 Ys presents via EMS a short time following MVA. he was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head (1 min LOC). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 40 mph on impact. pt c/o mild vomiting, severe headache, moderate nausea and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 180 cm, Weight 60.8 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 93, SystolicBP 109, DiastolicBP 69, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

Value.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

content2.Value: CT Head , MRI Brain , and performed E/MALE Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed ,

td.content: s:M aged 48 years presents for approx. one (1) week f/u after sustaining a mild concussion (LOC 1 min). he denies vomiting, nausea and headache since the accident. he has had no subsequent loss of consciousness (LOC). he has resumed usual state of function. o:Height 181 cm, Weight 61.9 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 94, SystolicBP 113, DiastolicBP 74, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=97,Visual Memory=96,Processing Speed=43.0,Reaction Time=0.49, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.

content2.Unmatched: No deficits , Eyes = normal pupillary reflex ,

Term.SOAP_SECTION: head, eyes, ears, nose, throat Examination
